feed.title: Greenfire Resources Closes Business Combination with M3-Brigade Acquisition III Corp., Announces Public Listing on the New York Stock Exchange, Senior Secured Note Refinancing and New Credit Facilities
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources Inc. has completed its business combination with M3-Brigade Acquisition III Corp., valuing Greenfire at US$950 million. The newly combined company, Greenfire Resources Ltd., will commence trading on the NYSE under "GFR" and has also significantly advanced its capital structure through a US$300 million senior secured notes issuance and new C$50 million senior credit facilities. This strategic move aims to enhance liquidity, prioritize debt reduction, and position Greenfire as a leading intermediate oil sands operator with growth opportunities.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources Completes Fully Subscribed C$300 Million Rights Offering, Redeems High-Coupon Notes and Becomes Debt-Free
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources has successfully completed a fully subscribed C$300 million rights offering, which enabled the company to redeem all of its US$237.5 million 12% senior secured notes. This strategic move, combined with securing an undrawn US$275 million revolving credit facility, has rendered Greenfire debt-free and significantly enhanced its liquidity for future operations and growth. feed.title: Greenfire Resources' Announces Expiration and Results of Change of Control Offer for Senior Secured Notes Due 2028
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources Ltd. announced the expiration and results of its change of control offer for its 12.000% Senior Secured Notes Due 2028. A total of $5,000 in aggregate principal amount of notes were tendered and accepted. This offer was triggered by Waterous Energy Fund increasing its interest in Greenfire to 56.5% of the outstanding common shares.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources Announces Reconstitution of the Company’s Board of Directors, Acquisition of Additional Greenfire Securities by WEF and Continuation of the Strategic Review
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources Ltd. announced a significant reconstitution of its Board of Directors, with six WEF-proposed nominees joining and new independent directors appointed. This follows the termination of the Second Rights Plan and Waterous Energy Fund's (WEF) acquisition of additional Greenfire securities from Brigade Capital Management LP, increasing WEF's ownership to 56.5% at US$7.83 per share. The company will also continue its Strategic Review process with WEF's support, focusing on shareholder value enhancement.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources Achieves Massive 72% Jump in Oil Reserves, Values Soar to $2.7B
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources announced a significant 72% increase in its Total Proved and Probable (2P) reserves, reaching approximately 409 million barrels of bitumen with an after-tax net present value (NPV10 AT) of $2.7 billion. This update, based on an independent evaluation by McDaniel & Associates Consultants Ltd., also shows a 34% increase in Total Proved (1P) reserves to 235 million barrels. The company's future growth plans include a brownfield expansion and the potential relocation of the McKay central processing facility, aiming to boost production capacity and enhance shareholder value.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources Announces Future Growth Plans, Including Projects Under Development to Increase Net Facility Production Capacity by 74%, Representing Significant Potential Value for Shareholders
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources Ltd. announced future growth plans aimed at significantly increasing its net facility production capacity by 74%. These plans include a modernized SAGD drilling strategy, consolidation of well pads into a Super Pad design, brownfield expansion, relocation of an acquired facility, and restarting an existing processing train, all intended to enhance shareholder value and improve cash flow. The company also highlighted its undervalued position as a pure-play thermal oil sands investment opportunity.

feed.title: Waterous Energy Fund agrees to acquire shares of Greenfire Resources Ltd.
feed.summary: Waterous Energy Fund (WEF) has agreed to acquire 29,988,854 common shares of Greenfire Resources Ltd. (TSX and NYSE: GFR) from Allard Services Limited, Annapurna Limited, and Modro Holdings LLC. This acquisition, representing approximately 43.3% of Greenfire's outstanding shares, is valued at approximately CAD$327,778,174, with shares purchased at CAD$10.93 each. The transaction is subject to closing conditions and regulatory approvals, and following its completion, WEF will own 43.3% of Greenfire's common shares for investment purposes.

feed.title: Redefining Oil Sands Expectations | Greenfire Resources Ltd.
feed.summary: In this CEO Interview, Robert Loebach, Vice President of Corporate Development and Capital Markets at Greenfire Resources Ltd. (NYSE: GFR, TSX: GFR), discusses the company's corporate overview, its Hangingstone Facilities in the Athabasca region, and its production growth strategies. Greenfire Resources Ltd. is highlighted as an intermediate, lower-cost, and growth-oriented Athabasca oil sands producer focused on responsible and sustainable energy development in Canada.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources announces Q1 2024 results and reiterates 2024 outlook
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources announced its operating and financial results for Q1 2024, reporting consolidated bitumen production of 19,667 bbls/d and Adjusted EBITDA of $39.3 million. The company reiterated its 2024 outlook for production growth, debt repayment, and capital expenditures, despite potential impacts from northern Alberta wildfires. Operational updates highlighted redevelopment drilling at the Expansion Asset and ongoing efforts to address production challenges.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources Announces Q4 2023 Results, Year-end 2023 Reserves and Continued Success of the Company's Multi-year Drilling Program in Q1 2024, Including the Inaugural Extended Reach Refill Well at the Demo Asset
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources announced its Q4 and year-end 2023 operating and financial results, highlighting strong production and adjusted EBITDA. The company also reported its 2023 year-end reserves and provided an operational update for Q1 2024, including the successful inauguration of an extended reach refill well at the Demo Asset and ongoing drilling programs. Greenfire aims for continued production growth, debt repayment, and potential capital returns to shareholders, supported by its Tier-1 SAGD assets and the anticipated Trans Mountain Expansion Project.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources Announces Q4 2023 Results, Year-end 2023 Reserves and Continued Success of the Company's Multi-year Drilling Program in Q1 2024, Including the Inaugural Extended Reach Refill Well at the Demo Asset
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources Ltd. announced strong Q4 and year-end 2023 results, with consolidated bitumen production of 17,335 bbls/d in Q4 2023 and 17,639 bbls/d for the year. The company highlighted the success of its Refill drilling program and optimizations at the Expansion Asset, and its 2023 year-end proved plus probable (2P) reserves totaled 237.7 MMbbl with a net present value (discounted at 10%) of $2.4 billion. Greenfire also detailed its Q1 2024 operational update, including a seven-well extended reach Refill drilling program at the Demo Asset and an increase in consolidated bitumen production to approximately 20,000 bbls/d in the first two months of 2024.

feed.title: Greenfire Resources to announce Q3 2023 results and host conference call
feed.summary: Greenfire Resources Ltd. announced its intention to release Q3 2023 operating and financial results after market close on Tuesday, November 14, 2023. The company will host a conference call on Wednesday, November 15, 2023, at 8:00 a.m. Mountain Time to discuss these results, followed by a Q&A session. Greenfire Resources is a Calgary-based energy company focused on sustainable thermal energy production in Alberta's Athabasca region.
